website_summaries.verdict: Huge cooling system that includes a backlit pump head to match your system's lighting effects.
pros: Has a pair of 140-millimeter fans in the configuration, which delivers a huge amount of coverage area for cooling
Will work with many different Intel and AMD sockets
Operates with less noise than you'd think when running two fans
Fans will shut off completely when CPU is running at low temperatures
cons: Costs a bit more than others
May need to order extra bracket hardware for some setups

customer_reviews.title: Really nice cooler
customer_reviews.text: I traded my H100i got this 360mm H150i pro and it works amazing so far. I ditched the fans it came with because they dont push that much air. They are really quiet tho, but I'd rather have a cooler system for a better overclock. Im seeing a 20-25c drop in temps with the H150i with Vardar F4 120er fans. I used the same fans on the H100i for reference. Really worth it for an I7 8700k if you're overclocking. My chip would thermal throttle with the H100i almost instantly at anything over 4.7. Now im sitting at 5.1ghz and in the high 70's mid 80's while benching. In games its at 40 or so.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Monroe

customer_reviews.title: Does a very good job at cooling down my i7 8700k
customer_reviews.text: Does a very good job at cooling down my i7 8700k. I am getting frame rate boosts because of the lower temperatures and boost clock. Setup is not too difficult as long as you follow the instructions. Really nice fans and lighting! Also very quiet and good software to control everything.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Bilenko

customer_reviews.title: Buy new get used
customer_reviews.text: recieved product. you could tell right away something was open in the box it rattled bad. Opened box and screws, bolts, washes everywhere. The heat snink that bolts to the cpu had no cover on it and no thermo paste. I think this product was used before. The amd shield was already installed. Not happy at all
customer_reviews.author: BlackSunShin3

customer_reviews.title: Support is terrible
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased many coolers over my 20 PC building years. Every cooler from many cooler manufacturers prior to this one has worked flawlessly until the end of the PC's useful life. Nine months into the H115i Pro's life it has caused the CPU to shut down or not boot due to cooler failure. Ten days ago I used Corsair's support page to request repair or replacement of this unit under Corsair's five year warranty. I have yet to hear back from Corsair support. Greg Brown Plano, TX
customer_reviews.author: Greg Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great Cooler Intel Computer Build
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this cooler for an I7-9700K rig I built. Installation was not as bad as I was expecting it to be. I'm not a computer nerd by any length; so if I can install it, anyone can. That said, when in doubt, do what I did and 'read the directions.' I also pulled up youtube videos on installation procedures and fine tuning it which helped a ton. Cooler itself is very quiet and I've had zero issues with it so far (purchased/installed late Feb19). I've overclocked my CPU to 4.6 Ghz, am currently playing X4 Foundation on max settings, and the temperature gauge for my CPU has barely nudged upward. Use is for gaming and home applications/school.
customer_reviews.author: Labowski (Dude)

customer_reviews.title: Wow, leaps and bounds better than EVGA CLC 280 in every way.
customer_reviews.text: I previously had the EVGA CLC 280, the pump was horribly loud, the software conflicted with pretty much everything you can imagine, and the pump itself failed after only 2 weeks of use. This corsair unit looks nicer, plays nicer with other software, you have full control through corsair link software, and it is QUIET as can be. The hoses even seem to be much higher quality. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Scooby

customer_reviews.title: works but hope you don't need customer support
customer_reviews.text: this cooler works like its supposed to but if you have any questions about it the corsair products customer support is worthless. never even responded to my question. which if you are going to charge a premium for your brand name you should at least offer decent support with those products. this will most likely be my last buy from the corsair brand.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cooling and quiet.
customer_reviews.text: Screws are too long and deform the radiator fins when installing the fans on it. I added extra washers as spacers, included in the kit. Other than that works great. I cant hear it running, probably because it is overkill. I overclocked my i7 5820k from 3.3ghz to 4.2ghz using a preset motherboard config no problem. Temps under 80c on every core and fans dont spin up fast enough under full load to even hear them. Not bad for a 6 core processor on older architecture.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Ready

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!!!
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from the Corsair H100I V2. I was seeing temps around 60-70C when under load. On my Intel i7 8700K @ 4.9ghz. I installed this one and I idle around 25-30C and only hit 45-50C under load now. Thats a pretty good drop in temps. My H100I was also only about 2 months old. I wanted this because for one I got a new case that can take a 360 AIO and wanted to see if this H150I would do me any better. Very happy with it and the LED is nice and bright too. Love the Corsair software. If you are looking for a great AIO this one is amazing!!!
customer_reviews.author: Steven & Heather

customer_reviews.title: Awesome AIO, beware if you have a T500 case.
customer_reviews.text: This aio functions great, software is great, build quality is great... Admittedly I threw out the fans it came with for nicer fans from corsair (not to say these were bad, I just wanted rgb)... Install was a pain, not corsairs fault. Rosewill T500 case says a 140mm aio will fit mounted to the front of the case... Well that would be true if they had bothered to consider the extra room for the radiator intake/outake. Had to drill my own mounting holes to make it fit, so just be aware of you have that case. (again, not a corsair problem)
customer_reviews.author: Norm

customer_reviews.title: Pretty amazing results.
customer_reviews.text: Just got this today and so far I have to say, I've seen very big differences in my CPU Temps. Prior to this, I was using the stock CPU fan so as you can imagine, the differences were pretty impactful. This took me about 35 minutes to actually install so the install is relatively easy. The software (ICue) is something that you must download once you finish installing everything as that software is what allows you to control the fan/pump speed as well as the RGB settings. All in all, I definitely suggest buying this liquid cooling system. Easy to install and there are instant differences.
customer_reviews.author: UnholyV3nd3tta

customer_reviews.title: Lives Up to Corsairs Gold Standard Reputation
customer_reviews.text: I love my corsair 115i pro. It is cooling an overclocked 8700k cpu and I have yet to see the temps go above 50c at 4.8ghz. I did replace the thermal paste with arctic mx4 though I am not sure I even really needed to. Setup is extremely easy and icue is not as bad as people say. I love the software - its very easy to monitor fan speeds and temperatures.... not to mention, control all that rbg :D
customer_reviews.author: Sean Wilson

customer_reviews.title: working better than the h100i
customer_reviews.text: I have a 9th gen i7 9700K overclocked to 5.1Ghz, and it took this 280mm h115i Pro, with dual push pull Mag Lev fans to keep everything cool. I'm reading 27-29c at idle, and 85c full load. The 240mm h100i was also at about 29-30c idle, but full load pushes over 92c, which is too hot for my taste, also in a push pull configuration, all using Corsair's mag lev fans. I guess surface area is the name of the game, and another advantage of the h115i is the low rpm fans, maxing out at 1200rpms, which makes for a somewhat quiet running. Anything above 1400rpms becomes painfully aware
customer_reviews.author: F1racer

customer_reviews.title: Your money is worth more than this...
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the money. Expect to fail within 6 months. Corsair support is second rate, meaning, you will get your refurbished replacement from the warranty, but your going to have to hastle with them over the phone or via email where you can expect an error resulting in delays.
customer_reviews.author: TitaanXL

customer_reviews.title: RYZEN Processor Installers Beware!
customer_reviews.text: A great product that would have received a five-star rating for "easy-to-install" and performance. However, at the time of my build, Corsair failed to mention the need for special TR4 Mounting Bracket Kit required for use with Ryzen Threadripper processors. They could have easily included this information in the description of their product. Had this been done, I would have ordered the bracket on the same day. Their lack of communication resulted in my need to research the issue, discover the answer (of all places) on Youtube and order the part to complete the job and wait for delivery - wasting 10 days of my schedule.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Brubaker

customer_reviews.title: Great cooling without noise
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something that 1) Can cool a high end CPU 2) Makes as little noise as possible 3) Doesn't require installing any software to work well This AIO definitely meets all 3 criteria. I never hear it even under a heavy load, unless I really really try to listen for it in an absolute silent root. At the same time, it's good enough to cool my Core i9-9900KS (5GHz, no overclocking)! This is with its default (balanced) mode, so I didn't even have to install the Corsair Link software for it. This is also a big advantage for me, because I hate running any extra soft that I don't really want.
customer_reviews.author: User365643

customer_reviews.title: Nice long hoses, low temps
customer_reviews.text: I DID NOT use the stock fans, so I cannot speak to the performance of the cooler using those fans; when replaced with Noctua high pressure static fans, this cooler excels. Pump is quiet, Ryzen 2700X CPU is overclocked 12% and temps seldom break much higher than 42C. Note, in small cases, you may have to mount to front of case. Also note I have 2 fans "pushing" into the cooler, and I believe a "pull" setup yields the best performance. Will add 2 more fans for a total of 4 in a push-pull arrangement....
customer_reviews.author: Jason Green

customer_reviews.title: Another high quality product from Corsair.
customer_reviews.text: So far I'm very excited about this cooler. I've slowly been transitioning toward Corsair products for their build quality and warranty and this cooler is probably the most ambitious purchase. Having recently had bad luck with the Noctua coolers, I replaced that cooler with this H115i Pro and saw a drop of 5c in load temps with stock thermal paste. It runs cool and quiet with the maglev fans and fits perfectly in the front of my Define R5 case. My favorite bonus was being able to set the color of the cooler to match the temp so if I see >65c, it turns red. Very nice bonus!
customer_reviews.author: Andy Levesque

customer_reviews.title: Great except for Price Fluctuations and Noise
customer_reviews.text: I have this set up on PWM for an Intel i9-9900k. Keeps temperatures between 38-70C, which is great seeing that I've overclocked mine to 5.1 GHz. However, the price goes up and down all the time ($150-$170), and it's a lot louder than my previous H100i under load. I have it in a Corsair 500D RGB case, and you can definitely tell when it's spooling up under load. Not the biggest peeves, but $20 these days is a 120 GB SSD, and I think that's fairly unreasonable for a price fluctuation.
customer_reviews.author: James Berlin

customer_reviews.title: Is this Vanilla Ice because my processor is Ice, Ice, Baby
customer_reviews.text: This cooler is a breeze to set up, and my processor slapped on some shades and gave me a thumbs up from the BIOS after installation. You could go the self-build route for water cooling, but this is just way easier and warranty coverage is well worth it. This is for those who do not want to wring every single decimal hertz from their processor, but wants to run Photoshop while flossing in Fortnite, and talking smack on the web with 20+ webpages open. Well worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Minority Report

customer_reviews.title: Allows me to boost Ryzen 5 3600X to 4.1
customer_reviews.text: Wish the included installation instructions had more details for the AMD 4 cpu's, but after more research and thought, I was able to get it installed on my Asus rog gaming X570 and Ryzen 5 3600X. Used for gaming, I never hear the fans. The cpu is over clocked to 4.1 and runs under 50c while playing Division 2, GRW and Wolfenstein New Colossus on 2560x1440 res. 60fps.
customer_reviews.author: Richard D. Glass

customer_reviews.title: It works great. But is not easiest to install.
customer_reviews.text: It works great. But is not the best value for the money, and it is harder to install than others. I got it because I am doing a full corsair RGB build. If I was doing a mixed brand or another branded build I would have gone with something else. It wouldn't be my first choice for a non-branded build. But it does work great, and the slight inconvenience of installation and ICUE setup compared to competing solutions isn't that bad. It is the most quite 360mm radiator I have installed. So if getting the most quite radiator is your preference it is the best choice. Though for style and ease of installation it isn't high on my list.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great device
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to squeeze some extra performance out of my Ryzen 1700, so I needed to move on from my stock cooling solution. Thankfully, this was the answer. With stock cooling, my system would crash under full load on a modest 3.0 to 3.7 GHz overclock, and CPU temperature would reach the mid-70's. Now, my system idles at 27.5 C and never gets over 45 C, ever under full load. Installation of the 360mm model was a breeze in my Corsair 900D tower, and the device itself is easy on the eyes.
customer_reviews.author: Yvan

customer_reviews.title: Hoses too short.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to install in a Thermaltake CA-1F8-00M1WN-02 Core X71 Tempered Glass Edition Black and the hoses don't even come close to being able to go from the bottom to the cpu. I bought the case purposely to be able to mount the radiator on the bottom. I had to mount on the top which makes buying the case worthless as it is designed to have the radiator with 3 fans on the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Mark D

customer_reviews.title: Great performance, just a little noisy
customer_reviews.text: Little noisy when at stock speeds, but not overly so. After overclock, definitely noisier than some other models, but the cooling performance is worth the trade off. Like the look, but if you want more RGB options, look elsewhere. That said, using Corsair iCUE there are quite a few color options and they work well Would definitely not hesitate to recommend
customer_reviews.author: Corey M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Cooler - quiet even on an open air bench
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cooler for use on my test bench setup. It keeps every CPU I've put under it cool has both Intel and AMD mounting so when I swap mobos and CPU's I'm good to go. Right now its chillen down an R9 3900X with a 4.325 GHz all core OC @ 1.32v with temp peaks during extended stress testing and benchmark runs only reaching 74C. I am using Noctua NT-H1 paste since I switch out CPU's regularly and clean the block each time and reapply new paste. Normally I swap out the fans on AIOs with Corsair MLpros but this cooler comes with ML (Mag-Lev) fans so that was a bonus for me.
customer_reviews.author: J. Watterson

customer_reviews.title: This kit does not support the AMD TR4 like it says in the specs.
customer_reviews.text: I went to a lot of trouble and expense to purchase a kit that specifically names support for the AMD TR4. This kit does not no matter what the AMAZON ad says. I also found that the third party adapter brackets are not available at this time. Lovely. Back to the drawing board.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Extremely cool temps
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this AIO as a christmas gift for myself. I was using a Cryorig C7 low profile cooler before and hitting roughly 50c-60c during games with my i5-6600K not overclocked. After installing this. I noticed that the balanced mode gave me the same ish number so I set the fans and pump to max. While the fans are audible. It's not annoying at all and while playing Monster Hunter World, 1080p Ultra settings, my CPU runs about 38c with full load. That's absolutely amazing. I love this cooler and I regret nothing with this purchase. I will most likely be buying another for my SOs PC.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Good performance, radiator bent
customer_reviews.text: Included this in my Lian Li O11D build a few weeks ago - thermal performance has been good, CPU idles in the 30's. Software seems a bit clumsy and over-designed, but does the job. The big issue I had is that the radiator came pretty severely bent, to the point that the screw holes no longer lined up with the case. I'm sure I could gotten a replacement, but I didn't want to wait so I managed to get it straightened out with a hammer, but still a little disappointed - the box itself was in great shape, so I don't think it was damaged in shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur R

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING Cooling
customer_reviews.text: My computer came with a 120mm cooler that worked just fine for the most part, it was several years old at this point and I started messing around with overclocking to squeeze a little more juice out of the CPU. It was running hotter than I'd like (and I plan on upgrading instead of buying a whole new computer) so I bought this along with a couple extra fans for airflow, installed it with some Grizzly Kryonaut paste and it dropped my temps by ~25c while benchmarking my overclock. GREAT cooler, and the customizable lights look nice too.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Evans

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Seems the quality is down on corsairs AIO . Not sure what happened but I have purchased this very cooler before and for some reason this batch seemed to have that quality feel and looks not present.. cheep and missing parts that I normally get when I use this cooler . Can’t change the position on the hoses like before almost feels like you would break it if you tried to hard .. hose don’t twist on the radiator like before so trying to reposition the hose is impossible without breaking something . Just don’t seem the same .. .. very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Hornig

customer_reviews.title: Quiet Upgrade from older generation H100i
customer_reviews.text: I used to have an older generation H100i and after 6 years (a reasonable amount of time) the pump started to fail, raising temperatures. I got this to replace my failing unit and it's worked out great. The build quality feels ever so slightly lower, but I don't think that will affect longevity at all. It is much quieter than my old unit. I like that there's the option to plug it into internal USB pins, but taking over two root USB ports is too much to ask for me, so I plugged it in using a normal USB cable like previous generations.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Love this AIO
customer_reviews.text: Great AIO! I wish it came with the LL fans with RGB, but it works well. Just a PSA: make sure you install it either at the top of your case (as exhaust) or in the front (tube connectors/pump) at the bottom. Doing this will prevent any whining noises as well as extend the life of your AIO!
customer_reviews.author: Michael A.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent performance. Software meh
customer_reviews.text: I have Windows 10 64-bit, Intel Core i9-9900k, CPU at 3.60GHZ, 32.0Gb RAM, NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1080Ti. My FULL tower has a 8" fan and 2 6" fans already with it. And then also the Corsair liquid CPU cooler. So that's my set up and I can play Apex on ultra high graphics for 8 hours while having multiple streaming and multimedia programs running and my CPU never gets over 51 degrees Celsius. The CPU cooler runs smoothly and sounds beautiful. Software is meh because the updates are constant it seems. and every update i have had to re do some portion of my settings every time. THE CPU cooler always runs perfect, but im talking about color settings.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Allbright

customer_reviews.title: Decent product, poor customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Device works ok. Wasn't expecting thermal paste pre-installed. I've since avoided Corsair due to their remarkably poor customer service. Install would have been a breeze if I was installing it with Corsair's thermal paste but having to remove it and not having more tube angle flexibility lost them some stars.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit, great cooling, works like a charm.
customer_reviews.text: While I am not a super gaming enthusiast, I do build gaming style machines for business users. That said, I use water cooling for a few reasons, among them better performance, cleaner installs, and better dust extraction (it's easier to clean these things that your typical copper cooling fins). That said, I don't do crazy overclocking of the CPU, but I do give my systems a small boost. Never have had an issue and I love that you can correlate the color of the LED with your core CPU temperature using iCue software from Corsair. Pretty cool, I buy these exclusively now for all systems.
customer_reviews.author: Marius Morosanu

customer_reviews.title: Quieter and better looking as well as cooling than my old H100i
customer_reviews.text: I had an H100i pump fail on me, so I replaced it with the H115i. I not only like the 115i's looks better, but it's cooling and noise level is a step up from my 100i. I waited to review this as I wanted to make sure this product was worth it. My 100i only lasted 1 1/2 years. Hoping the pump in this 115i lasts much longer. So far through, it's kept my FX-8370 cool under load (18-28c) with idle around (8-12c). Which is a few degrees cooler than my older 100i. I've been impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Peylix

customer_reviews.title: all most perfect
customer_reviews.text: I don't like the fact that this product assumes you are only going to use the 2 included fans. The fan connection is split in 2 and is hard wired into the device. I had to bypass this with a 4 splitter hub. I use my own stand alone software to manage my temps as well as my fans so the corsair software can interfere here as well. other than that the device its self is great quality and keeps my temps down. It does what I want/need it to do. I will look into the new releases of the H100 to see what has been improved upon but for now the price was right on this model.
customer_reviews.author: Wrxstiftw

customer_reviews.title: Never update any software or firmware.
customer_reviews.text: If this cooler and pump works when you plug it in, never update iCUE or the firmware. It will brick the unit and it will never work again. You will need to RMA the unit through Corsair, which has horrible customer service and it could take years to get a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: Very efficient cooler.
customer_reviews.text: I had to watch a video on how to install as the directions weren't the clearest. Having said that, this cools my intel 9700k easily. Gaming my cpu temps rarely hit 50c. Under full load stress test it only gets to 70c. The fans are very quiet and work well. Great cooler.
customer_reviews.author: LMS

customer_reviews.title: UNREAL!
customer_reviews.text: I had the older, 2 fan setup and bough this with the hopes that it would run quieter. I turned my computer on the other day as I was walking past it and had to stop a few steps away because it was so quiet I needed to see if I had actually successfully turned it on. I get 29*C idling and when i'm crushing BF5 I get about 36*C. It's a million times quieter than my old setup. It works with the new IQue software (the corsair rep said they are phazing out Corsair link) and it was a breeze to install. Much easier than the older models. I highly recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Came broken. Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Came with busted radiator fins. There was like a chunk of wood lodged in the radiator. Not that big of a deal, still functionally ok.... or so i thought. Missing hardware. Came with the AMD mounting bracket and not the intel one, which was what i needed. Didnt have the standoffs or the thumb screws, so i cant even attach it. Stopped my build completely. Now i cant get a replacement because there's not in stock. Extremely disappointed. Spent this much money to build a family pc for xmas. Poor quality control ruined it completely.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Palkowitsch

customer_reviews.title: Quieter than a purring cat at max load
customer_reviews.text: I went with the 280 x 2 radiator and I kindof had to botch it into my NZXT 500 case, but I'm actually really pleased with the result. That little extra performance is really worth it to me. I probably would have been better off with a 240 mm x2 radiator if I wasn't such an enthusiast. That extra 100 Mhz means a lot to me though. The build construction is incredibly nice, just watch out for the fins on either side. The listing here gives dimensions. Shop smart!
customer_reviews.author: Robotech Industries

customer_reviews.title: Looks good and does its job
customer_reviews.text: Do far this works great. I was worried after reading some of the reviews but this worked for what I wanted and so far it hasn't let me down *knock on wood* I replaced the fans that came with the cooler with some corsair RGB ones, so note that the box that goes over the cpu is RGB but the fan that come with are not. The corsair software is pretty good, it's realitively easy to adjust the speeds of the fans and the RGB on the box. Its my first time building my computer myself and this was easy to install, and the cables are too hard to figure out. Overall works great anf looks amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Rae

customer_reviews.title: doesnt cool as good as you would expect from a 360mm aio
customer_reviews.text: dropped my cpu temps 20c and Im concerned that the pump is gonna go out because on the 3rd day I noticed when I start my pc up I can hear the pump make a weird grinding noise but goes away after it starts up. the noise is similar to when youre turning a car on and you crank the key for too long and the starter makes a loud grinding noise
customer_reviews.author: Adan Villa

customer_reviews.title: Can't ask more from this unit.
customer_reviews.text: Corsair has knocked it out of the park again with this AIO cooler. I have it running on an AMD Ryzen 7 2700 and heat is not even a thought when doing any CPU heavy tasks. Gaming, Adobe Premier video editing, even during Prime95 torture tests this thing did not even flinch. I have it paired with the 2 fans it comes with and a pair of Corsair LL 120MM fans in push/pull setup and it has yet to be even audible in my setup. The RGB is nice on it to match up with your system if going that route, or you can use it for a temp monitor if not. Highly recommend it for modern builds!
customer_reviews.author: Jake A.

customer_reviews.title: Better then Nh-D15
customer_reviews.text: This cooler works great and looks cool, it even outperforms the massive legendary NH-D15 cooler from Noctua in some cases. The only way it can outperform the NH-D15 is if the pump and all the fans are set to Extreme. But it still does outperform it. So if you are an overclocker and are wanting that few degrees cooler temp then this is the cooler for you. Uses a Gen 6 pump which is the new and improved version of the Gen 5 pump.
customer_reviews.author: seanne waguespack

customer_reviews.title: Great cooler but the fans are a bit noisy
customer_reviews.text: Coming off a Mac break back into PC, it's no wonder I can hear all the fans. The constant whining of the fans up and down to adjust to the cooling needed for the CPU is rather annoying to me but may not be to others. However, with that being said, the CPU cooler works as intended keeping my 7980XE down to a cool 40C package while gaming and multitasking while working throughout the day. A great way to keep cool and have a clutter free motherboard at the same time!
customer_reviews.author: Buffy

customer_reviews.title: Might be perfect for you. Might not.
customer_reviews.text: I got this thing installed correctly, but just barely. To fit it in my case required quite a bit of finessing, but after a few hours I made it work. If your mobo is right where you're going to install the radiator, you might want to remove your mobo completely before installing. Important to know: You may get an error when booting up after switching from a CPU fan. Simply go into BIOS, find "CPU FAN" and set it to "ignore" You're also likely to hear bubbling or rattling when you first install it. As long as your screws are nice and tight, you can wait it out and the sound will disappear as the components settle
customer_reviews.author: Tyler M.

customer_reviews.title: Must Have!
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from a Corsair H100i to this and I love it. Temps have dropped from 10 - 20 degrees on my overclocked Ryzen 7 1700x. No complaints and hope I don't come up with any. Did the next day delivery and it came the next day, no damage or anything to the box or contents. I almost went with the NZXT Kraken x72 but did some homework comparing the 2 and there isn't really a difference performance wise, less than a degree in difference plus the Kraken x72 is like $25 more so I recommend the Corsair H150i Pro over anything out right now.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan (pardon the pun)
customer_reviews.text: I returned this item. It would not tighten properly onto the CPU and from looking online the seems to be a common and long standing issue that they have not addressed for some reason. I was not particularly happy with it prior to realizing that anyway. It would only install with the logo upside down and that plus the LEDs wasn't a good look in my build, also the tubes were stiff and short which made my particular build difficult.
customer_reviews.author: HiGravity

customer_reviews.title: Nice aio cooler
customer_reviews.text: The aio liquid cooler is working great. I love the ability to control pump and fan. The fans are quiet. It was easy to install. For the price I am paying, think the fans should be rgb pwm fans. My biggest complaint is that the stock fans aren’t rgb. I think the temperature reading is from the pump and not the cpu package temp. Need to be careful not to use that as your core temp. This thing will handle 150W TDP around 60~70C. At 200W TDP the core temp goes to 95~110C.
customer_reviews.author: Luan Vo

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Had to buy a longer cooler with smaller fans Than what i had but both of my coolers are Corsair h series and both have been outstanding. You money is worth it with this cooler, if you like RGB though these are just standard fans
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian

customer_reviews.title: Do not order this cooler for a four standoff AMD
customer_reviews.text: H100i PRO cooler..what a piece of crap. if your AMD CPU has four standoffs do not order this cooler, The bracket they sent will in no shape form or fashion fit. If Corsair is looking to downgrade their reputation this cooler will get it done. I only gave one star because I had to. need a no star option.
customer_reviews.author: D T Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Came with parts missing.
customer_reviews.text: The box did not come with the mounting hardware, guide, or brackets. Just the Radiator and pump and the three fans. This completely stopped my build and because I can't use my new p.c. I can't do a job interview. So not only did this halt my build, but may have cost me a job I've been trying to get for years. Thanks Corsair, you bunch of dopes. You owe me parts and a nice salary.
customer_reviews.author: Kzwisler

customer_reviews.title: Tight fit mounting on top of case.
customer_reviews.text: I'm using a Fractal Design Refine R5 case, Corsair h115i 280 cooler, and Asus Prime z370-a. I had to use an utility knife to shave off part of the cooler fan in order to mount the radiator on top (and need to purchase a low profile 140mm fan for rear exhaust). The H115i is silent! I wasn't sure my system was on initially (i'm also using a Seasonic Prime 600w fanless PSU). So far, everything is running cool.
customer_reviews.author: Waldorf-type mama

customer_reviews.title: "Cleaner" alternative to air cooling
customer_reviews.text: As many reviewers have stated, the 150i's cooling capacity to noise ratio isn't any better than a standard Noctua dual tower cooler. Pump noise is acceptable, but the included fans ramp to 900+ RPM to control temps at >60W cpu power draw with the included thermal paste. This results in a somewhat noisy though still effective cooler. Unit is otherwise built and packaged well, and the design is clean.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Great Replacement for older Corsair AIO Water Cooler
customer_reviews.text: After about 2.5 years my older version of this Corsair AIO water cooler was starting to ineffectivly cool my i7 6850k processor which normally runs hot. Running 47-55 degrees Celcius idle. I changed the thermal paste and even the liquid myself to no avail. I guess the pump was failing. This was a good replacement now running 37 Degrees celcius idle and not too noisey. I am sad to say that the radiator does not look as good as the older model but definitly works better!
customer_reviews.author: PC

customer_reviews.title: Great cooling, loud fans!
customer_reviews.text: The fans certainly push a lot of air, but they are loud and make an unpleasant tone. They also make a ringing noise at different RPMs (currently I have the fans set to quiet, and I can hear ringing coming from the fans. This was really annoying because they are advertised as being quiet. The pump is attractive with the RGB lighting and it does the job keeping my cpu cool, I just wish they didn't include such noisy fans. I have ordered Noctua radiator fans hoping that it makes a difference. If you are sensitive to annoying sounds, you may want to look elsewhere unless considering upgrading the stock fans.
customer_reviews.author: Pugmum

customer_reviews.title: Hoses are too short for core P5 case
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cooler specifically for use in a Thermaltake p5 core case, but the tubes are too short and will not allow proper mounting in said case. Other than that shortcoming it seemed to be a well-made cooler and I'm sure it's fine in a typical atx enclosed case. Be advised I did not actually use it at all, once I realized it would not work I returned it. I wrote this review in hopes of perhaps saving someone else from learning the hard way as I did.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Real good but can be hard to have pc find the pump
customer_reviews.text: So the h100i is really good keeps the cpu cool, came with intel bracket on and and in the box, and was easy to put on . Installing wasn’t really to bad could be difficult though if you rush it. The issue I had was the usb that controls pump speed and lighting using the link software/ique, I hooked up like it said to but my pc would not find it so what I did was by a male USB adapter then plug it into a usb 3.0 in the back of the pc and it’s working great!!
customer_reviews.author: Rosalind Livingston

customer_reviews.title: Super cool
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to the build. I would like to see a few things explained a little better in the manual with more picture illustrations but I'm a newbie to close loop coolers but I did have to do a few searches for other questions just to make sure I hooked it up to my particular setup I7 8700k at full load holding 20c temp
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great water-cooler
customer_reviews.text: Had to steal parts off of an older board, if you have AMD and don't have the original heat sync seat, be prepared to buy or find one. I was upgrading from an h80i and had to scramble to find one, as it doesn't come in the kit.
customer_reviews.author: JayGrimm

customer_reviews.title: Really helped cool my 6700
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to an I7-6700 and a new 2070 GPU. I haven't overclocked it yet, but there was a noticeable reduction in temp just running normally. I didn't test the temp difference empirically, but it was enough that you could feel the difference. I think it was important due to the 2070 putting out quite a bit more heat than my last card. Easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Dale

customer_reviews.title: Thank you for your incompetence.
customer_reviews.text: Claims to come with a TR4 socket, but doesn't. This was to replace a fairly new H100i with a dead pump that died silently. The old socket didn't fit this cold plate. Corsair support was unhelpful and indifferent to the fact that my work computer is out of commission because of their low quality parts. Now, their inability to check a listing's accuracy has extended how long my work computer is out of commission. I won't be trusting corsair again with my business.
customer_reviews.author: Ed M

customer_reviews.title: Good quality AIO cooler
customer_reviews.text: This is an easy to install AIO cooler. I've had these Corsair coolera last for years without issue. The only compaint I have is that they are prone to shipping with air bubbles in them that need to be shaken out of the pump.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Amazing cooling product!
customer_reviews.text: Keeps my 1070ti cool even when running at 100% load. Fan speed profiles are easily set in Corsair software so that they only run as fast as needed for the current situation. This has been going strong in my new rig for over 3 months and I have the 2 fan version in another pc that has been working without issue for over 5 years! Highly recommended and I will update if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: D C

customer_reviews.title: I wished the fans were RGB but whatever.  The radiator looks great in my Corsair 570x case
customer_reviews.text: This cooler works great. The radiator easily attached to the fans on the front of my Corsair 570x. I mounted the fans that came with the cooler to the top and rear of the case for additional airflow. I do kinda wish these fans were RGB but it's okay without that feature. They're really quiet when running. I have not used the 0 rpm feature yet and just have them set on quiet mode for now.
customer_reviews.author: LBKewee

customer_reviews.title: Damaged Radiator out of the box...
customer_reviews.text: Fins on the Radiator came pretty damaged... Scared of potential leaking. Nothing more exciting than having to deal with this while building a new a 9900K/2080TI Rig.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Useless to not include mounting hardware for processors.
customer_reviews.text: No mounting hardware made this an utterly useless purchase and waste of time. The fact that you have to go buy hardware for an item of this value because they dont include islt is extremely unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: SublimeDavid

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cooling
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, keeps my CPU at less than 40C. Instructions were not as clear as desired in terms of the mounting bracket screws to use. For my chipset the instructions said to use the smaller bracket screws when I needed to use the longer bracket screws in order to be able to secure the mount to the cpu on my motherboard. No harm no fowl, but it was an annoyance to have to unscrew them and put in the longer screws.
customer_reviews.author: EJ Tom

customer_reviews.title: Very reliable AIO
customer_reviews.text: Very reliable AIO from corsair I've owned a previous model with just an RGB logo and it's still going strong after 5 years with heavy gaming use . The RGB looks great if that's your thing and is controlled by ICUE software which isn't horrible . My only con would be the fans they are a little loud at 50 percent and sound like a jet at 100 .I went with Noctua NF-12's and haven't looked back .installing it wasn't to bad either ,its pretty straight forward on an intel platform.
customer_reviews.author: digitalexone

customer_reviews.title: It’s beast might need some nylon washers to help with install
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast first and foremost, would recommend and I upgraded from an older single rad Corsair AIO. 2 things I would’ve like to see. Backplate for the 1151 board while construction quality is way better than the one I from the other kit, had required a small spacer between the stud and the board. As nothing was included it would be nice have some nylon or foam washers to remedy this. The other thing is the backplates no longer have the foam pads they used to come with to prevent even accidental rubbing on the back of the board. The space is still there for them too.
customer_reviews.author: Garret Amundson

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Got the H100i 240mm model, worked great for my i8700k. Overclocked between 4.6GHZ and 5GHZ, voltage 1.34V. Room temperature air conditioned at 70 Fahrenheit degrees. Maximum CUP temperature at 75 Celsius (165F). I can see Corsiar has made good improvements on the flexibility of the tubes, as I'm comparing with my old Cosair H series cooler. But, I'm still having a hard time twisting the pump unit to make fit and sit onto the CPU mount. Because both tubes has same length.
customer_reviews.author: Zhuo Li

customer_reviews.title: Nice and Quiet
customer_reviews.text: I have the 360mm rad top-mounted in a Lian Li O11 Dynamic and it keeps my 3900x in the low 40s at idle and mostly below 60 while gaming. Best thing is how quiet it is, much quieter than my old 280mm NZXT cooler. Even on the "Extreme" profile this is quieter than the NZXT was. Didn't have any issues installing it, haven't had any issues controlling it with iCUE.
customer_reviews.author: SierraDelta

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year Corsair H110 stopped working/pump died and I needed a fast replacement. Thankfully, Amazon had same day shipping on the 240mm. I love the RGB and most importantly I love the cooling. My PC stays at 26C idle on an i7 8700k. I thought about going for the more expensive version, but this one is at decent price point and the cooling is fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Rox

customer_reviews.title: excellent product, I had to send this back because ...
customer_reviews.text: excellent product, I had to send this back because it was 1 inch to big, I suggest physically measuring your case to make sure this will fit: I ended up just ordering the H115i Pro the 280 radiator. I have a gaming MATX case and a Miner in a ATX case and it still did not fit. Just measure before you buy.
customer_reviews.author: Reynaldo Juarez

customer_reviews.title: Corsair
customer_reviews.text: I received two of these and both were defective. Stay Away!!! Not good for Ryzen 3900X
customer_reviews.author: Frederick

customer_reviews.title: Pump failed in 8 months of use
customer_reviews.text: After owning this for 8 months, the pump completely stopped working. Very disappointed on the pump quality Corsair has been using lately. Read the reviews, these pumps are prone to fail.
customer_reviews.author: Christian L.

customer_reviews.title: good but is it worth the price?
customer_reviews.text: its a good product. i'v had the 100 and 110i before. and honestly the 110i and the 150i perform the same i9-9900k not sure why i went with a bigger radiator and more expensive
customer_reviews.author: Mohammad Sawwan

customer_reviews.title: Damaged when it got here.
customer_reviews.text: I opened my box and begun to take it out and boom water everywhere. Nearly soaking my in progress computer ruining thousands in parts. This should never happen this is a computer component with water inside that is going to get closed up in a case and in some cases be unseen for years. To have a leak from shipping or just from lack of quality control is insane at this price point. Shame on Corsair they seem to only be in it for the money these days something to complain about with every component of my build this time... pretty disappointed will definitely be looking else where for my next build. STAY AWAY!
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: Was not the easiest thing to install but once I got it down I've had no issues. There is some noise and whine but I don't know if it's the video card or the cooler.
customer_reviews.author: Marls

customer_reviews.title: Great Cooler
customer_reviews.text: Very Quiet, Looks Great! Easy installation and instructions were pretty straight forward. Fairly certain model comes with mounting items required for AMD/INTEL(both normal and server form factors) This cooler has a large radiator and may not fit your case when mounted in certain positions. Please be sure to take the time to research your specs and desired installation position to avoid any incompatibilities that could occur
customer_reviews.author: Scrub

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cooler!
customer_reviews.text: Mounted at the top in my Corsair 460x case. Despite other reviews saying this wouldn't fit, I found that in fact it does with about 5mm between the bottom of the radiator and the top of my ram. Was able to overclock my ryzen 7 1700 to 3.8ghz and stay at ~70C over a one hour stress test. Very happy with this!
customer_reviews.author: Justin Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Very good thermal performance and very quiet
customer_reviews.text: My older PC has an H115i with push-pull fans (a total of 4 high quality Corsair and Noctua140mm fans). With all fans running max, the difference in thermal performance between the H50 and this isn't significant, but this cooler is much much quieter. Running at a more noise optimized setting, this is much better at cooling. So if you have room in your case, I highly recommend this cooler
customer_reviews.author: Gary271

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT FIT THE TR4 AS STATED
customer_reviews.text: Specifically states this will fit the TR4, and it doesn't.... Turns out this product USED to fit the TR4 and then they made a design change and want you to pay an extra $22 for a bracket.... EXTREMELY upset that I am unable to finish my build. I won't purchase another Corsair AIO.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: So cool it manual swapped my car and subscribed to monster energy deliveries by the crate
customer_reviews.text: I overclocked a ryzen 2700x to the max and it just won't get spicy. There's no heat. Where'd it go? Only my case fans know. He a thicc boi and a lighter than expected boi. Definitely not an itty bitty boi. I had a 33-2 suicidal thought to happy vibe ratio while installing this so I'd highly recommend some tunes and bourbon to go along with the install.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cooling, may not fit in all applications
customer_reviews.text: Item provides excellent cooling capacity for my Ryzen 7 2700x and works very well. I am using it inside a ThermalTake Core V21 ( in conjunction with a Noctua 200mm fan (that I jerry-rigged in there). If you look at the case I am using, you can see how much room there is for a Micro-ATX build. This will probably not fit in many other mATX builds.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Redlich

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: In comparison to my old stock cooler this thing is amazing. Runs my CPU on idle at 24C at it's base clock and 32C up .7GHz. Even when at 100% I haven't seen it reach 60C. It's very high quality, looks amazing and performs better than expected. Installation the first time was fairly difficult but that was more because of my workspace and me not exactly understanding it's directions. I highly recommend this for anyone looking into water cooling.
customer_reviews.author: J H

customer_reviews.title: failed
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware. I spent the extra money and bought this over an air cooler and it leaked within 1 year exactly. I saw it leaking in my case and shut down. I have a somewhat new ryzen build and had I been absent my board at the least would be toast. Customer service offered to replace it but I refused. I will not take a chance again. The cooler was never moved since installation!!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Pizzurro

customer_reviews.title: This aio works great
customer_reviews.text: Im not a huge tech person but honestly I have no complains about it so far. I got the one that has a dual fan radiator and it keeps my cpu pretty cool. It keeps it between 33 and 35 degrees Celsius when its idle or just watching videos. Its about 40 -45 degrees Celsius when when gaming or doing anything strenuous. Installing it is pretty easy even for someone that has basic computer knowledge. I would say this is a very good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Christine M.

customer_reviews.title: now here is a cool product!
customer_reviews.text: works awesome, but i dont understand how some people can get a clean looking install with this thing ( not that it matters that much) but there are cables and crap all over the inside of my computer. but this sure keeps my process cool and easy running. It was a bit a hassle installing it, finding room for it was not as instructed and after some creative bolts and screw this is awesome!!!
customer_reviews.author: grippla kukalapiTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: youll take sometime installing it, but its worth it
customer_reviews.text: It was hard mounting this AIO on my SPEC 06, but im impressed by how well it mantains temperatures on my OC i9, you can download iCUE to customize the fan speeds and rgb, only downsides are the fans dont have leds and seems like its not compatible with mystic light so i was unable to sync the rgb with my msi motherboard, otherwise an excellent (and over the top) cooling solution.
customer_reviews.author: Nikolai Enríquez

customer_reviews.title: One of the best coolers I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: I'm running the ryzen 1700 x overclocked and it runs like a dream the fans don't make any noise really at all the only thing you need to do after you install the unit is download the software from their website which is very easy make sure you're up-to-date on your software once you've installed it and it runs itself pretty much it allows you to customize it as well in the option menu I love it I'm going to be buying another one for my brother
customer_reviews.author: joshua

customer_reviews.title: stupid mistake but how/where do I go about ordering just ...
customer_reviews.text: I need the backplate accessories for this for my intel 8086K CPU. I had to return a motherboard just a few days ago to Amazon because of bent socket pins. Unfortunately I forgot to remove the backplate for this cooler so now I can't install this. stupid mistake but how/where do I go about ordering just the backplate accessories for this because mine is headed back to amazon attached to the mother board I returned....stupid mistake on my part.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Zombie

customer_reviews.title: Works incredibly
customer_reviews.text: I use this on an Intel i7 8700k with a 3440x1440 ultrawide and a 1080p second monitor, under full load in full resolution games such as PUBG, Rainbow 6 Siege, Grand Theft Auto V etc I never see CPU temps over 55C. Super easy to install. I bought thermal paste and installed it over the thermal button that comes pre assembled into the cooler, probably overkill but again, never over 55C. The LED settings are really easy and cool, I have the led set to change colors with the cpu temp as a "live" reading of cpu temp.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Not for THREADRIPPER Despite False Advertising
customer_reviews.text: This does not include the bracket for the TR4 threadripper CPUs despite the misleading advertising. For that you must buy the "Platinum" Version with the stupid looking RGB lights in the fans. Returning this crap now!!! Stop being cheap and put the necessary brackets next time.
customer_reviews.author: Jared P.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cooler
customer_reviews.text: The cooler is easy to install and instruction were good. The only real complain is that the fans that get installed onto the radiator should be LED for the price I paid. No biggie. ***NOTE*** The iCue software that controls the LED on the pump hogs 10-15% of your CPU! This is a bug and Corsair is aware of it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Glickman

customer_reviews.title: Misleading on support. Not sure how it works as ...
customer_reviews.text: Misleading on support. Not sure how it works as of yet as it has one major missing part. No socket AM4 support out of the box. You have to order the adapter as another part. Should be really clear up front but just an FWI for anyone that runs into the same situation.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Change the paste!
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Bought this one to replace an older one that went bad after many years. When installed my temps went through the roof because the pre-applied paste was crap/old/whatever. Wiped it off with some 90% alcohol and applied Noctua paste instead. Temps drops over 20c on first boot. Good cooler, fans can get loud if you have it cranked. I keep it on Silent Mode and CPU cores stay in the 30-40c range. Ran stress test and got close to and around 60c at 100% load on 5820k at 4.2ghz. 6 cores at max with the cooler on the minimum settings. Nice.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Turkeys

product_meta.title: Corsair Hydro Series H100i PRO RGB AIO Liquid CPU Cooler, 240mm Radiator, Dual 120mm ML Series PWM Fans, Advanced RGB Lighting and Fan Software Control, Intel 115x/2066 and AMD AM4 compatible
product_meta.description: Style:Single| Size:240mmThe CORSAIR Hydro Series H100i PRO is an all in one RGB liquid CPU cooler with a 240mm radiator built for low noise cooling performance and bold styling with an RGB LED pump head. Two included 120mm ML Series magnetic levitation PWM fans provide great airflow and static pressure, with a wide PWM speed control range between 400 RPM and 2, 400 RPM. Take control with CORSAIR iCue software and customize lighting, monitor temperatures and precisely adjust fan speeds, or stop cooling fans entirely with the H100i's Zero RPM fan mode. Easy to install and compatible with most major CPU sockets, the H100i makes it easy to cool your system in silence and style. Fan Speed: 2400 RPM. Cold Plate Material : Copper and Radiator Material : Aluminum.
feature_bullets: Powered by Magnetic Levitation: Two low noise 120mm ML Series magnetic levitation PWM fans deliver incredible airflow and static pressure at low noise levels
Powerful Software: CORSAIR iCue software allows you to adjust RGB lighting, individual fan speeds, and pump speed while monitoring CPU and coolant temperatures
Compatible Sockets: Intel LGA 1150, 1151, 1155, 1156, 1366, 2011, 2011 3, 2066 and AMD AM2, AM3, AM4, FM1, FM2
Dynamic Multicolor RGB Lighting: Vibrant RGB LED pump head produces vivid lighting effects to match your build. Air flow 75 CFM. Noise level 37.0 decibels
Zero RPM Mode: Zero RPM cooling profiles allow fans to stop entirely at low temperatures, completely eliminating fan noise. Radiator Dimensions 276mm x 120mm x 27mm. Fan Dimensions 120mm x 25mm

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars3,375 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
